messages.message: Hallo there Austria 😄
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'Hallo there Austria 😄'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A VIE - GAL, F TRI - ALB, A BUD - SER. Should I trust FRANCE?
messages.output: You should not trust the message. In the previous phase, France did not provide any concrete strategic information, only a friendly greeting. It's better to be cautious and not reveal your true intentions based on this message alone.

messages.message: Hey. Would you mind asking Germany to bounce in Bur? I want him to have an army in Mun to scare off the Italians, and if he’s going to be stuck in Mun bouncing Bur he might as well guarantee Tyrolia.
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'Hey. Would you mind asking Germany to bounce in Bur? I want him to have an army in Mun to scare off the Italians, and if he’s going to be stuck in Mun bouncing Bur he might as well guarantee Tyrolia.'.

messages.message: I did ask him. Just trying to ensure I’m protected from Italy. I’m a very nervous Austria player.
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'I did ask him. Just trying to ensure I’m protected from Italy. I’m a very nervous Austria player.'.

messages.message: I’ve heard that you plan to force Bur.
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'I’ve heard that you plan to force Bur.'.

messages.message: Yes, but I do not intend to attack Germany with it. If I'm telling the truth about forcing Bur I'm telling the truth about not attacking him.

messages.message: That sets you off balance if Italy moves F Nap - TyrS or to Pie
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'That sets you off balance if Italy moves F Nap - TyrS or to Pie'.

messages.message: The F Nap - TyrS opening is rare, but checks in Pie are not. Even if he doesn’t hit Mar, he could let Bur move into it, removing the ability for you to build a fleet there.

messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'Well what should I do then. Are you just worried about your ally Germany?'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: A VIE - GAL, F TRI - ALB, A BUD - SER. Should I trust FRANCE?

Proceed with caution and consider the possibility of France trying to steer the conversation away from crucial strategic elements.

messages.message: I’m worried about a lot of stuff not in the western triangle. You all seem much more rational than Turkey, Russia, and Italy. A juggernaut is a possibility as is an opening to sil. Across the board, I’m pushing for predictable play in 1901 so that I can make an informed decision about who to work with. If everyone goes with openings that are used < 20% of the time, then, especially as Austria, I’m screwed.
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'I’m worried about a lot of stuff not in the western triangle. You all seem much more rational than Turkey, Russia, and Italy. A juggernaut is a possibility as is an opening to sil. Across the board, I’m pushing for predictable play in 1901 so that I can make an informed decision about who to work with. If everyone goes with openings that are used < 20% of the time, then, especially as Austria, I’m screwed.'.
